title: Multiple Select From Molecules to Organisms S111
prompt: Which two of the following are the independent variable and the dependent variable in this experiment?
description: Researchers conducted an experiment for a new drug intended to treat a respiratory disorder. The test was undertaken over a one week period. During this time, three hundred participants lived and slept in a controlled environment and were continually monitored. Half of the participants were given no drug, but were simply monitored as a control group. The other half of the participants were given the proposed drug treatment. By the end of the study, the experimental group showed a 12% improvement in lung function over the control group. The researchers concluded that the drug is a valid treatment for the respiratory disorder.
feedback: The independent variable is the effect that causes change in the dependent variable. In this case, the independent variable is the drug treatment, and the dependent variable—the variable being measured—is lung function. The researchers are trying to determine if the drug treatment is effecting a positive change to the participant’s lung function.
